speaker: Outstanding Directorial Achievement in Comedy Series
text: James Burrows, Bill Carroll, Brian James Ellis, Steven Pomeroy, Rick Beren  * * *  ## Transcript {David Langley}    _Act 1  Scene 1 - Frasier's Apartment_  **SUNDAY IN THE PARK WITH EDDIE** [_Fade in.  Daphne is ironing, Martin comes from the kitchen with a beer._]

speaker: Martin
text: What the hell are you doing?
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Directorial Achievement in Comedy Series

speaker: Daphne
text: Ironing your son's socks.

speaker: Martin
text: Why don't you just twist them into little balls like you do mine?

speaker: Daphne
text: He says it bruises the cashmere.  He likes them pressed, folded, then neatly arranged in those sock dividers.  I saw them in a catalogue once, but couldn't imagine who in the world would ever buy such silly things.  Course, I hadn't met Dr. Crane yet.

speaker: Martin
text: [_sitting in his chair_] I used to think there was some sort of mix-up at the hospital.  Of course, when Niles came along it shot that theory all to hell.  [_Frasier comes in from the bedroom._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Dad, Dad, please.  Coaster.  [_puts one under the beer_] Your beer is sweating.

speaker: Martin
text: So am I.  You wanna shove one of those under my can?  [_The doorbell rings, Frasier goes to get it._]

speaker: Daphne
text: If he could, he would.  [_Frasier opens the door to a neighbor._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Mrs. Greenway!  What a pleasant surprise.

speaker: Dorathea
text: [_storming in and pointing at Eddie_]  I knew it!  That's him!

speaker: Frasier
text: Won't you come in?

speaker: Dorathea
text: I had to see him again before I was sure, but now I'm positive.  That is the horny little mixed-breed who got my Phoebe pregnant.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, you can't just bust in here accusing my dog!

speaker: Dorathea
text: Oh, it's him all right!  I had to keep shooing him away from Phoebe down at the park.  Look at him, he doesn't care who's life he's ruined.  All he cares about is his own selfish pleasure!

speaker: Martin
text: You know what your problem is, Dorthea?  You got a bad attitude.

speaker: Dorathea
text: [_heading back to the door_] Oh!

speaker: Martin
text: That's why nobody sits with you in the park.  [_Eddie jumps over to the couch, staring out the door._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Mrs. Greenway, there's no way Eddie could be the father, he's been neutered.

speaker: Dorathea
text: Oh, really?!  Then how do you explain these?  [_She shoves a box of puppies into his arms._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, my God!  They're miniature Eddies!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_overcome_] Oh, aren't they adorable?  Oh!

speaker: Dorathea
text: Well, I'm glad you think so, because they're yours! [_leaves_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh! [_to Eddie_] Bad dog!  Look what you did!  [_Eddie jumps back to Martin, Frasier gives the box to Daphne._  ]

speaker: Frasier
text: Here, take these.  Dad, Dad, I expect an explanation.  All this time I thought Eddie had been fixed.

speaker: Martin
text: All you had to do was look.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I am glad to say I've never been that bored.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_cuddling the puppies_] Ooh, couldn't you just eat them up?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for God's sake, please, don't love them.  They'll think they're staying. [_shoves them back in the box_] Keep them off the couch. [_to Martin_] What were you thinking, letting him run free in the park?  Haven't you ever seen the way he tries to romance my towel warmer?

speaker: Martin
text: Look, he's cooped up here all day.  When we go to the park, I let him off the leash so he can get a little exercise.

speaker: Frasier
text: Apparently, that's not all he got.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_holding out a puppy_] I think I found the perfect name for this one...

speaker: Frasier
text: STOP!  Dogs only need names if you are planning to call them to you, which we are not. [_grabs a puppy that got loose_] Oh, now listen you, you get right back in there, you mangy little thing.  Oh, my God... all right, all right, now I've got to run down to the radio station, but believe me we are going to be having a discussion about this when I get...

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, relax, Frasier.  I'll have Eddie taken care of tomorrow.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well you better.  Now, Daphne, give me that box, please.

speaker: Daphne
text: Where are you taking the puppies?

speaker: Frasier
text: To see if I can unload some of them down at the station.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, well, couldn't we just keep them for a while?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, we don't want them taking after their father.  [_As he carries the box to the door, all the puppies suddenly stand on their hind legs inside the box and look at Frasier._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Though it may be too late already.  Oh, for God's sake, STOP STARING AT ME!  [_He leaves.  Fade out._]   **CATWOMAN** [_Roz is on her side of the booth reading.  Frasier comes in behind her._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Roz, don't you look lovely...

speaker: Roz
text: [_not looking_] I know what's in the box, and I don't want one.

speaker: Frasier
text: But I didn't say anything!

speaker: Roz
text: Betty from Accounting called to warn me.  Where did you find them, anyway?

speaker: Frasier
text: In my living room.  These are Eddie's mongrel seed. [_crossing to his side of the booth_] You don't know anybody that wants six puppies, do you?

speaker: Roz
text: Six?  All right, Eddie!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, please!  I've been traipsing up and down the hallway for an hour, trying to unload them; I haven't had the slightest bit of luck.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, you see Frasier, not everybody likes dogs.  Take me, I'm a cat person.  I mean it's not like I'd ever buy a cat mug or a cat calendar, or anything, but; I had a cat when I was growing up.  We were almost inseparable.  Muffles... or Scruffles, something like that.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Roz, it's entirely possible that there's a dog lover inside of you that's just dying to get out.  Don't you think so?  [_She shakes her head, he picks up a puppy and gives it to her._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Come on, come on, just, just take a look, just have a look, let's have a look...

speaker: Roz
text: [_with a melting smile and cooing_] Ooh, he's adorable! Oh, come here little fella.  Oh, aren't you the cutest little thing?  Oh, oh, oh, yeah, give me a little kiss. Ooh, I love you too! [_Then hands the puppy back with a completely flat face; deadpan_] There, happy now?

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz!  How can you just toss him aside after such a tender display of affection?

speaker: Roz
text: I can do it with men, too.  Come on, Frasier, it's time to start the show.  [_Frasier holds the puppy up to a man passing by the window._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Phil, puppy, puppy!  [_Phil wards him off with his hands and keeps walking_] They're all on to me.  All right, now, you guys behave yourselves.  [_He puts on his headphones and Roz cues him through the window._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Seattle, this is Dr. Frasier Crane coming to you from KACL 780 talk radio.  I'll be with you for the next three hours.  So Roz, who's our first caller?

speaker: Roz
text: We have Rita on line four, she's feeling a little overwhelmed at home.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Rita, I'm listening.

speaker: Rita
text: Yeah, Dr. Crane?  Dr. Crane... I'm, I'm- uh, thank you for taking my call.  I, I, I tell you, I am about to lose my mind.  I am raising four kids by myself, the oldest one is not even seven and the other three are all under five. Between cooking and cleaning and changing diapers and tripping over toys... I, I feel sometimes like I'm about to snap.  What should I do?

speaker: Frasier
text: Have you considered getting a puppy?  [_Roz looks at him in disbelief.  Fade out._]   **UN PEU DE PATE DERRIERE LES OREILLES** [_There is a family of four, the Thomases, holding one of the puppies and talking with Daphne._]

speaker: Thomas
text: Well, if we can't have this one, are there any other puppies available?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, we found homes for all the others.  But thanks for coming over, 'bye now.

speaker: Thomas
text: But, the children.  Dr. Crane said...

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, don't get all wobbly now.  There are other dogs in the world, you know.  Now give me that. [_takes the dog from the little girl and ushers them out the door_] Thank you for coming over, thank you.  [_She closes the door behind them, Frasier comes in from the kitchen with a tray._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I thought you might like some wine and pate, and I made some lemonade for the children...  [_He looks up and sees no Thomases, only Daphne protectively cuddling the puppy._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_coldly_] Where are the Thomases?  Why is that dog still here?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sorry, Dr. Crane, but they struck me as unfit guardians.

speaker: Frasier
text: For God's sake, he works at the zoo!  She's a nurse, Billy's an altar boy and Kathy is a Camp-Fire Girl!

speaker: Daphne
text: They had a dark aura.

speaker: Frasier
text: They had a ten-acre farm!  If they'd have taken me, I'd have gone with them!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I see!  So you want me to give the little fellow away to just anybody. [_The doorbell rings._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, no, I'm not saying that.  It's just that he can't stay here.  [_He answers the door.  It is Niles._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hello, Niles.  Come on in.

speaker: Niles
text: Hope you don't mind my stopping by, but Maris is hosting the Women's League Senior yoga group and... old money in body stockings... [_grimaces_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Say no more, you're welcome to hide out here.

speaker: Niles
text: I see the kennel is still open.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but that's the last one.  I'd even managed to find a nice home for him, but Daphne thought the family wasn't nice enough.  Some pate, Niles?

speaker: Daphne
text: I didn't reject them, the dog did.  Canines have a very keen sense of who's a nice person and who isn't.  Why, many's the time I've chosen a man based solely on the way my mum's springer spaniel took to them.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Daphne, that is preposterous!  Letting a dog choose your dates?  [_When the others aren't looking, Niles takes a dab of pate from his cracker and applies it behind his ears._]

speaker: Daphne
text: It's true!  If a dog likes a man, it's a good bet he's warm and sensitive.

speaker: Niles
text: [_going to the couch and taking the puppy from Daphne_] You know, I really didn't get a good look at this little tyke. Come here, boy, come to your Uncle Niles.  [_The puppy begins licking behind his ear._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Look at that!  He's taken quite a shine to you.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, happens all the time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, would you mind taking the dog away, please?  Get back on the phone with the Thomases, tell them we've reconsidered.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_taking the puppy_] All right.  But only for a two-week trial.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Come along, Basil.

speaker: Frasier
text: I told you not to name them!  [_Daphne exits.  Martin comes in with Eddie._]

speaker: Niles
text: Ooh, hello, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Afternoon, boys.  [_Martin undoes Eddie's leash.  He jumps on the coffee table and scurries over to Martin's chair._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, I seem to remember that Eddie had a little appointment down at the vet's.  Can't help but notice he still has that certain spring in his step.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, well, we started heading down there, but the traffic was a bear, you know.  You get a sunny day in this town and everybody forgets how to drive.  [_He goes into the powder room._]

speaker: Frasier
text: You are going to reschedule, aren't you?

speaker: Martin
text: [_through the door_] Oh, yeah, yeah, I'll call in the morning.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's the second time you've canceled that appointment. What seems to be the problem?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, it's no problem.  What's the big deal?  I'll call tomorrow.  Relax, will ya?  [_Eddie jumps on the couch beside Niles and begins licking behind his other ear._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, dear God, he's licking me!

speaker: Frasier
text: Eddie, just stop! [_He shoos Eddie away, then grabs Niles's head for a closer look._] Oh, Niles, you have liver behind your ears.

speaker: Niles
text: I imagine I must have picked up a cracker and inadvertently scratched behind my ear.

speaker: Frasier
text: So you're telling me that you had a wad of cold meat behind your ears and didn't feel it?

speaker: Niles
text: That's the story I'm sticking with, yes.  [_Martin comes out._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, Dad, listen: I want your assurance that you'll take care of this.

speaker: Martin
text: Fine.

speaker: Frasier
text: You promise?

speaker: Martin
text: Hey!  I said I'd do it and I will.  You don't have to pin a note to my sweater, get off my back!  Anybody wants me, I'll be down at Duke's. [_He leaves._]

speaker: Niles
text: Ever notice how much faster he moves when he's wrong?

speaker: Frasier
text: Apparently he's got some sort of psychological block against taking Eddie down there.  Guess I'm gonna have to do it.  Somebody has to be responsible in this family. OK, come on, Eddie let's go.  Good boy. [_Eddie runs over to the kitchen table._] Eddie?  Uh, Niles... [_He motions for Niles to help him._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_coming around the other side_] Now Eddie, it's a routine operation.  They say it's almost painless, [_to Frasier_] although I can't imagine...

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Niles, perhaps it's best we don't discuss the operation.  We might spook him

speaker: Niles
text: Excuse me?  Are you saying he understands me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, he understands the word B - A - T - H.  God knows how much english he's picked up.

speaker: Niles
text: Fine.  _Tu tournes a droit._

speaker: Frasier
text: _Ah, bon, bon.  Je marcherai derriere lui.._

speaker: Niles
text: _Mais, tu es celui qui va l'amener chez le medecin pour le... snip-snip._

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.  _C'es vrais, mais..._ oh, what are we doing?  Eddie, come here! This is ridiculous.  Look at him.  Oh, for Pete's sake.  [_Eddie races away to the bedrooms as Niles and Frasier give chase._]  _Act 2  Scene 1 - The Vet's Office_  **DOCTOR!  NO!** [_Frasier is sitting in the reception area, Eddie is on the chair beside him, staring at him intently._]

speaker: Frasier
text: What are you staring at?  You know why you're here, don't you?  Well now, listen, it's for your own good.  Believe me you'll be much happier afterwards.  Look, your day-to-day routine, it'll be exactly the same.  You'll be able to sleep, run around with your little buddies, go play in the woods, chase the birds, lick your... did I mention sleep?  [_Martin comes in the door._]

speaker: Martin
text: You've got a lot of nerve, you know that?!  You all right, boy?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, of course he's all right, Dad.  Why are you getting so upset?  I'm only doing this to help you out.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, that's a load of crap.

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, we agreed that this had to be done, right?  Now, you seem to be have a problem with it, so I took charge.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I don't need you taking charge.  Eddie's my dog, so mind your own damn business.  And here's something else you should know: I don't need your help and I don't want it!

speaker: Frasier
text: Why are you so upset?  It doesn't matter who brought him down here.

speaker: Martin
text: Yes it does!  I'm perfectly capable of taking care of him. Just like I feed him, walk him and give him his bath!  [_A man comes in and leaves the door open.  Eddie runs out_]

speaker: Martin
text: Eddie!  See what you did!

speaker: Frasier
text: Me?!  [_They rush out the door.  Fade out._]   [_Martin is on the phone._]

speaker: Martin
text: OK.  Thanks, and oh, Daphne's here in case anybody sees him. [_hangs up_] I got the guys at the station circulating Eddie's picture.  I'm gonna go out and look for him so more.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, come on, now.  You've done enough.  Why don't you just sit still and drink your tea?

speaker: Martin
text: I hate tea!

speaker: Daphne
text: Humor me.  In an emergency, it's all I know how to do.

speaker: Martin
text: That's a real comfort coming from a health care provider.  [_Frasier comes in the front door.  Martin and he share an uncomfortable look._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, I'm sorry.  There was no luck at the pound.  They said they'd call if they find a dog matching Eddie's description. [_spotting a flyer by the phone_] A five hundred dollar reward for Eddie?!  [_Martin glares at him._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you sure it's enough?

speaker: Martin
text: Right now it's about five hundred more than I'd pay to get you back.

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, Dad, I said I was sorry.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I just can't sit here.  I'm goin' back to the park.

speaker: Frasier
text: The park again?  What makes you think he's gonna show up there?

speaker: Martin
text: Because that's his hangout.  Didn't you ever have a place like that?  A place where you went to meet women, a place where you got lucky?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I suppose so, yeah.

speaker: Martin
text: Didn't you go back?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_with feigned enthusiasm_] To the park!

speaker: Martin
text: This time we'll comb every inch of that place.  Every tree, every bush... uh, Daphne, we're gonna need more help, so call Niles and tell him we'll pick him up. [_she nods_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, wouldn't want to go out in the wilds without one of the world's great outdoorsmen!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_holding her head_] Oh, this is odd.  I just got one of my psychic flashes.  It's about Eddie.

speaker: Martin
text: Well?

speaker: Daphne
text: It doesn't make any sense.  All I'm getting is a picture of Eddie sitting with Dr. Crane.  [_Cut to - a bus bench with an ad for Frasier's show.  Eddie is sitting on it, staring at Frasier's picture.  Fade out._]   **THE STAKEOUT** [_Martin is sitting in Frasier's car, Frasier climbs in._]

speaker: Martin
text: Any luck?

speaker: Frasier
text: I couldn't find him.

speaker: Martin
text: Where's Niles?

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, we split up to cover more ground.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, scrunch down.  If Eddie comes back and sees you here, he'll run away again.  [_Fraser slumps down in the seat with an embarrassed look on his face._]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Dad, maybe we oughta call it a night.  You've been sittin' in this car for three hours.

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, that's nothin'.  I was on a stakeout once for fifteen hours without ever gettin' out of the car.  We had a contest to see who could last the longest.  The winner was "Canteen" McHugh.  Know why we called him that?

speaker: Frasier
text: I think I can guess.

speaker: Martin
text: Because his bladder was the size of a canteen.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you for clearing that up.

speaker: Martin
text: You could've slung his bladder over your shoulder and gone on a twenty mile forced march through the desert.

speaker: Frasier
text: Big, huh?

speaker: Martin
text: Isn't that what I've been sayin'?  [_Frasier rolls his window down._]

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, close that window!  It's freezin'!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Dad, it's like a blast furnace in here.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm cold, okay?  At my age, you get cold easily.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right.  [_He rolls the window back up._]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know Dad, I've just developed a very intersting theory about you...

speaker: Martin
text: [_sarcastic_] If I begged you, would you share it with me?

speaker: Frasier
text: If that's your attitude, just forget it!  [_The car phone rings and Frasier answers it._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello?  Oh, Niles!

speaker: Martin
text: Did he find him?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Just a second, Niles, let me put you on speaker-phone here. Hang on. [_he sets the phone down_] OK, go ahead, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: [_from the phone_] I'm out here in the middle of the park and I'm lost!  Thank God for my cellular!

speaker: Martin
text: Did you see Eddie?

speaker: Niles
text: No, but I thought I saw a raccoon.  When I stopped running, I had no idea where I was.  You've got to help me!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, all right, Niles, just, just remain calm.  Let me think back to my Boy Scout training. [_opens the car sun-roof_] All right, now, we're on the northeast corner of the park... all right, look into the heavens and see if you can spot the North Star.  Then you want to turn twelve degrees to your right...

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, for God's sake, just walk towards the horn. [_begins honking_]

speaker: Niles
text: I hear it!  I hear it, Dad!  I'm walking.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, just keep following it. [_honks again_]

speaker: Niles
text: I see a grove of trees, and a fountain, and... a horrible, wretched, hunchbacked old man!  Stay away from me!  No, no, it was just a bush.  OK, OK, things are beginning to look familiar now.  Keep honking.  I think I'm homing in.  Yes, I'm quite sure this is the way.  [_He climbs into the back seat, still talking into his cellular._]

speaker: Niles
text: OK, you can hang up now. [_hangs his up_] That was a harrowing experience!

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, a shrub and a raccoon in one night and you lived to tell about it.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, I'm sorry I couldn't find Eddie.  I hope you'll understand, I think I'd like to go home now and hold my wife.  That is, if she'll let me.  I'll just hail a cab.

speaker: Frasier
text: Be sure to call us from the curb when you get there, so we know you're safe.  [_Niles gets out._]

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, you're probably tired too.  If you want to go with him, that's OK.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, that's all right, Dad.  I'll stay for a little while longer.

speaker: Martin
text: Look, I'm sorry I cut you off like that before, I've just never gone in for that psychological mumbo-jumbo.  Probably started back on the force when they'd make us go see The Squirrel.

speaker: Frasier
text: Who?

speaker: Martin
text: Dr. Bergman, the department shrink.  We called him "The Squirrel" 'cause guys got sent to him when they got squirrelly.  He'd show you a bunch of ink-blots and ask about your toilet habits...  If I wanted to talk about toilet habits, I woulda stayed partners with Nate Dombrowski.  We nicknamed him "The Big..."

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you!

speaker: Martin
text: Look, it wasn't just Eddie I was mad about.  Eddie was the straw that broke the camel's back.  Seems like I'm always being told to take my feet off the furniture, put a coaster under my beer, turn the TV down... I used to make the rules, and now I have to follow them.  This makin' any sense to you?

speaker: Frasier
text: From a psychological standpoint, it makes perfect sense. Slowly, over the years, your responsibilities have been taken away from you, and you, well, you feel symbolically castrated.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, why does everything with you shrinks start in the crotch?

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, all right.  Well, maybe my rules are too rigid. Maybe I should try to relax a little.

speaker: Martin
text: No, no.  Hey, it's your house, you do what you want.  I don't know what's buggin' me.  I guess it's not easy for a guy like me to not be in charge.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Dad, a lot of people confuse not being in charge with not being respected.  I hope you're not making that mistake, because you command a great deal of respect. There's not a day in my life when I don't hold myself up to the Martin Crane yardstick.  I guess a son always wants to make his father proud.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I guess.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, yeah, you're doin' fine.  [_muttering_]  Even if you are a big pain in the ass.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I'm not sure I could have made Eddie go through with that operation, anyway.  That's a tough thing for a guy to do to another guy.

speaker: Martin
text: Amen to that.  [_Eddie jumps up on the trunk of the car, Frasier spots him in the rear-view mirror._]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know what?  It's getting kinda late.  What do you say we go home and get some sleep?  [_Eddie barks._]

speaker: Martin
text: [_opening his door_] Eddie!  Hey, hey, come here boy! [_Eddie jumps in and sits on his lap._]  Hey, atta boy!  Hey, good to see you fella, how ya doin'? [_to Frasier_] It might be nice if you welcomed him back.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Eddie. [_pets him_] Good dog - oh, wet dog!

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, you're shivering! [_grabs some clothing from the back seat and wraps it around Eddie_] Here, we gotta get you warmed up!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad!  That's a hundred percent cashmere pull-over!  [_Martin glares at him_]  It's meant to be worn with the collar up.  [_He adjusts it on Eddie.  Fade out._]
